author: AllaMoscow
title: Excellent accommodation for a selebration -
text:
We have visited Villa Spalletti a week ago for a 25th wedding anniversary of our friends. Villa Spalletti is a small family hotel with the grandeur of a royal palace - you feel exactly like a royal person the moment you enter and till the end of your stay.
Staff is extra polite and friendly, with a personal touch you never find in huge 5-star hotels.
Note they have a Russian-speaking girl at reception and a Russian-speaking waitress at breakfast. The breakfast itself is superb, with a variety of fresh juices, a collection of meat and salami, a variety of excellent cheeses, yoghurts, fresh fruit, warm freshly baked bread etc. you can order from an egg dishes selection, porridges, pancakes,waffles etc.
There is also a small but delicious a-la-carte menu for lunch or dinner if you happen to stay in the villa between your tours of discovering Rome.
Minibar is free, being refreshed each day. There is a free bar at the 1-st floor sitting room from 5 pm, you can relax in a cosy atmosphere of a royal villa. There is also a small garden where you can sit with your drinks, or order your lunch there.
Each room has its own name, ours was St. Angelo on the 2nd floor. Spacious, sun-drenched room, cosy bed, excellent linen. A nice touch is the huge old-style window with old wooden window blinds. Bathroom is gorgeous with villeroy@boch equipment, and excellent bathroom amenities. The best thing is a huge and thick white floor mat!
We also had an anniversary dinner at the Villa arranged by our friends. I liked everything, especially the home-made pasta. However the duck breast was rather dry, pity. Excellent wine choice.
A very touching point - the young owner, Andrea Spalletti, had greeted us on the evening of the celebration!
Perfect long weekend in Rome. Will definitely return!!
